website_summaries.verdict: Overall, the Reebok Print Lite Rush has made a lot of consumers contented with its perfect fit and style. Aside from its structure, they appreciated the footwear's excellent quality. Although one of the users have problems with its ankle cushioning, others still lauded and recommend the Reebok Print Lite Rush because of its good quality. They said that the shoe is a good choice for those who want to take their running activity to the next level.
pros: Several runners commented that the Reebok Print Lite Rush was comfortable
According to some reviews, the footwear has good quality
It was a supportive shoe, as noted by one of the buyers
According to those who have tried it, the footwear provides a snug fit
Some of the purchasers commented that the Print Lite Rush was true to size
Its nice design was loved by several runners
cons: One of the testers said that the shoe has no ankle cushioning
As a result, he felt a little pain while running

customer_reviews.title: Strange Fit - Good Value Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have to wrestle with these shoes to get them on, but once they're on they are comfortable. There is ample toe room, they are not too narrow, and the heel-box isn't tight once worn. The only issue is the struggle to actually get them on, where they wind up feeling too small. Ordering a .5 size up may help. I wear an 8.5 or a 9 - but i found the 8.5 to be an OK fit. Always err on the side of caution if you're unsure. I have not used these for running yet and I don't plan on - they are probably more suited for just casual sneaker use, but could be used for running if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality
customer_reviews.text: Shoes got ripped and fell apart 35 days after purchase date. I couldn't return it or replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft
customer_reviews.text: Shoe not suitable for running; toe box is flat and fabric is soft with no reinforcement or toe protection. More suitable as a casual sneaker or light training.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: Reebok is now made for those with extremely narrow feet. It was like stuffing Mike Tyson into a pair of Levi 501 jeans. If you have wider than average feet go with Saucony or Mizuno - New Balance is going narrow now too.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: It's a bit narrow and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Material is good but it's not comfortable for me to walk.
customer_reviews.author: Chihong

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and comfortable. Good value for the price. A good walking shoe (which is what I wanted) but insufficient support for running.
customer_reviews.author: PVCO24

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair for both my husband and son, they are very pleased
customer_reviews.author: tiffany roques

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 11 but .11 is really like 10 so order a size up
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo 2000

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great look, great fit, super lightweight and extremely comfortable. Looks great with a set of scrubs
customer_reviews.author: Toby Cole

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and doesn't wear easily.
customer_reviews.text: I have loved these shoes eve since I got them, they are very comfortable and I like how the tread doesn't wear out very quickly like most Nike shoes do.
customer_reviews.author: Nathanael S.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good product for 22$. It is very light and comportable. Size is just true
customer_reviews.author: Yasar

customer_reviews.title: No comfort
customer_reviews.text: Not a great product, no comfort. Assumed it would be a running shoe but not even fit for walking
customer_reviews.author: Neeraja

customer_reviews.title: Color
customer_reviews.text: Am loving it i would buy one more but just not seeing the color i would
customer_reviews.author: Linval Tyndale
